Posts.Content: May 31, 2009 04:18PM - edited May 31, 2009 04:20PM by Ithought41wastooyoung Hey there ladies, I am done!  I am home and have been since 1 day post op.  Surgery was the 27th.  They do not look as bad as I thought they would and I am not in much pain.  Honestly, the hardest part of my day is getting up in the morning because I am not sleeping as well as I need to be due to the drains.  I have 4 of them in place right now.  I sleep on my side so it is hard not to be able to turn.  The couch is my new bed until I get these out because there is more support with the pillows etc.  My upper back hurts just because I think I am not comfortable.  I never took Tylenol because it never works on me, but they did not want me to take ibuprofen and I only took about 4-5 percocet and I was done hallucinating (I kept seeing faces of people......wierd I know), so I took the Tylenol and they actually work really well.  The sentinel lymph node biopsy was a little nerving.  But it was all good.  Then the surgery went very well.  The lymph nodes all tested negative.  I was thrilled with that.  My sister was a huge help with meals and the kids.  Because of her, my hubby was able to be there for me, and he was great.  Tomorrow is my first day home alone so to speak.  I cannot drive or lift heavy items, but I really feel pretty good.    Linda.....good thoughts coming your way!!

Posts.Content: May 18, 2009 02:42PM Ithought41wastooyoung wrote: Well, this is a group that I was not expecting to be a part of either, but we are all feeling that way I am sure.  I was just told on May 5th, 2009 that I also had DCIS.  I went for my yearly check up and mammogram early April.  I got a call telling me that I needed to come back because I had a "change" and they wanted to have another look.....then when the radiologist wanted me to come back to talk I knew it was not a good thing.  I then went and met with the surgeon, thinking I was going to get a needle biopsy only to be told that I needed to have an excisional biopsy in same day surgery because I had calcifications.  What the heck are they????  I thought why in the world do we do all of these self breast exams only to find out that you cannot usually feel calcifications.  Now I am starting to seriously panic.  I did really well with the biopsy.  No pain.  That night I went and saw my sons T-Ball game.  Went in for my post op alone because I really did not think this was going to be anything.....and I was sent home with a bright pink bag walking through the waiting room.....I was sooooo embarassed.  Well since that day I have met with a plastic surgeon as well as the general surgeon and I am scheduled to have my double masectomy with reconstruction on May 27, 2009.  I opted for this because I do not want to live my life worrying each time I have a mammogram about results, and the fact that since I got it in this breast I have a higher chance of getting it in my other breast.  Cancer is like wild fire in my family and I do not want to live in fear anymore than I already do.  So my choice was a quick and easy one.....but I am scared.   I am getting the sentinel lymph node tested to see if there was any spread....the surgeon highly doubts it, but there is always a chance.  Hopefully, he will be right.  After this I will have months of getting my expanders filled until they can make the switch to the implants they believe some time in September/October.  This turned out to be a much longer process than I would have ever thought.    I have a hubby, 4 and 14 year old and hopefully this will not be too much of an inconvenience with our life.  I will have the drains after surgery but not sure how long.  Unfortunately the surgery is on Wednesday and my sons birthday party was already scheduled for Saturday along with my daughters dance recital.....I must be out of my mind to think I could be able to be there.....I am not sure how soon to expect to be able to do things..... So that is my deal and I want to be your ear and support as well.  Lisa
